title: Introduction to geoidep
text: package aims provide R users new way accessing official Peruvian cartographic data various topics managed country’s Spatial Data Infrastructure. offering new approach accessing official data, technical-scientific entities regional local governments, facilitates automation processes, thereby optimizing analysis use geospatial information across various fields. However, project still construction, information can visit GitHub official repository https://github.com/ambarja/geoidep. want support project, can support coffee programming moments.

title: Introduction to geoidep
text: Also, can install development version follows:
code: install.packages("geoidep") install.packages('pak') pak::pkg_install('ambarja/geoidep') library(geoidep)

title: Introduction to geoidep
code: providers <- get_data_sources() providers #> # A tibble: 107 × 7 #>    provider  category    layer         layer_can_be_actived admin_en year  link  #>    <chr>     <chr>       <chr>         <lgl>                <chr>    <chr> <chr> #>  1 INEI      General     departamento  TRUE                 Nationa… 2019  http… #>  2 INEI      General     provincia     TRUE                 Nationa… 2019  http… #>  3 INEI      General     distritos     TRUE                 Nationa… 2019  http… #>  4 Midagri   Agriculture agriculture_… TRUE                 Ministr… 2024  http… #>  5 Midagri   Agriculture oil_palm_are… TRUE                 Ministr… 2016… http… #>  6 Geobosque Forest      stock_bosque… FALSE                Ministr… 2001… http… #>  7 Geobosque Forest      stock_bosque… TRUE                 Ministr… 2001… http… #>  8 Geobosque Forest      stock_bosque… TRUE                 Ministr… 2001… http… #>  9 Geobosque Forest      stock_bosque… TRUE                 Ministr… 2001… http… #> 10 Geobosque Forest      warning_last… TRUE                 Ministr… last… http… #> # ℹ 97 more rows layers_available <- get_providers() layers_available #> # A tibble: 8 × 2 #>   provider  layer_count #>   <fct>           <int> #> 1 Geobosque           5 #> 2 INAIGEM             3 #> 3 INEI                7 #> 4 Midagri             2 #> 5 MTC                27 #> 6 Senamhi             1 #> 7 Serfor              1 #> 8 Sernanp            61

what: 4. Download Official Administrative Boundaries by INEI
title: Introduction to geoidep
code: # Region boundaries download  loreto_prov <- get_provinces(show_progress = FALSE) |>    subset(nombdep == 'LORETO') library(leaflet) #>  #> Attaching package: 'leaflet' #> The following object is masked _by_ '.GlobalEnv': #>  #>     providers library(sf) #> Linking to GEOS 3.12.1, GDAL 3.8.4, PROJ 9.4.0; sf_use_s2() is TRUE loreto_prov |>    leaflet() |>    addTiles() |>    addPolygons() # Defined Ubigeo  loreto_prov[["ubigeo"]] <- paste0(loreto_prov[["ccdd"]],loreto_prov[["ccpp"]]) # The first five rows head(loreto_prov) #> Simple feature collection with 6 features and 9 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -77.82596 ymin: -6.14773 xmax: -69.94904 ymax: -0.03860597 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #>      id objectid ccdd ccpp nombdep                nombprov shape_length #> 136 136      136   16   02  LORETO           ALTO AMAZONAS     9.955533 #> 137 137      137   16   07  LORETO       DATEM DEL MARAÑON    11.493679 #> 138 138      138   16   03  LORETO                  LORETO    13.602250 #> 139 139      139   16   04  LORETO MARISCAL RAMON CASTILLA    15.113580 #> 140 140      140   16   01  LORETO                  MAYNAS    14.501777 #> 141 141      141   16   08  LORETO                PUTUMAYO    20.443604 #>     shape_area                           geom ubigeo #> 136   1.569481 MULTIPOLYGON (((-76.30752 -...   1602 #> 137   3.881998 MULTIPOLYGON (((-76.49832 -...   1607 #> 138   5.574816 MULTIPOLYGON (((-75.74592 -...   1603 #> 139   3.054652 MULTIPOLYGON (((-72.08996 -...   1604 #> 140   6.197942 MULTIPOLYGON (((-75.24086 -...   1601 #> 141   3.725588 MULTIPOLYGON (((-75.10004 -...   1608

title: Introduction to geoidep
code: my_fun <- function(x){   data <- get_forest_loss_data(     layer = 'stock_bosque_perdida_provincia',     ubigeo = loreto_prov[["ubigeo"]][x],     show_progress = FALSE )   return(data) } historico_list <- lapply(X = 1:nrow(loreto_prov),FUN = my_fun) historico_df <- do.call(rbind.data.frame,historico_list) # The first five rows head(historico_df) #>   anio perdida rango1 rango2 rango3  rango4  rango5 tipobosque ubigeo #> 1 2001 2081.97      0   0.00  40.05  519.21 1522.71          1   1602 #> 2 2002 3923.46      0   0.00 136.71 1254.51 2532.24          1   1602 #> 3 2003 1843.92      0   0.00  23.94  584.73 1235.25          1   1602 #> 4 2004 4269.33      0   0.00 351.36 1818.00 2099.97          1   1602 #> 5 2005 4948.20      0   0.00 351.09 2020.50 2576.61          1   1602 #> 6 2006 2274.48      0 209.07 152.64  689.22 1223.55          1   1602

title: Introduction to geoidep
code: library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union historico_df |>    inner_join(y = loreto_prov,by = "ubigeo") |>    ggplot(aes(x = anio,y = perdida)) +    geom_point(size = 1) +    geom_line() +    facet_wrap(nombprov~.,ncol = 3) +    theme_minimal(base_size = 5) +    labs(     title = "Pérdida de bosque histórico del 2001-2023 \npara las provincias de Loreto",     caption = "Fuente: Geobosque",     x = "",     y = "")

what: Download Peruvian data managed by the Spatial Data Infrastructure (SDI) of the National Institute of Statistics and Informatics (INEI) of Peru
title: Download Peruvian data managed by the Spatial Data Infrastructure (SDI) of the National Institute of Statistics and Informatics (INEI) of Peru
text: goal geoidep📦 offers R users easy accessible way obtain official cartographic data various topics, society🏛️, transport🚗, environment🌱, agriculture🌾, climate⛅️,among others.includes information provided regional government entities technical-scientific institutions, managed Spatial Data Infrastructure Peru.

title: Download Peruvian data managed by the Spatial Data Infrastructure (SDI) of the National Institute of Statistics and Informatics (INEI) of Peru
text: can install development version geoidep like : also official version available CRAN:
code: install.packages('pak') pak::pkg_install('ambarja/geoidep') install.packages('geoidep')

title: Download Peruvian data managed by the Spatial Data Infrastructure (SDI) of the National Institute of Statistics and Informatics (INEI) of Peru
text: example, can identify list providers available geoidep layers present. summary suppliers number available layers
code: library(geoidep) get_data_sources() |>    head() #> # A tibble: 6 × 7 #>   provider  category    layer          layer_can_be_actived admin_en year  link  #>   <chr>     <chr>       <chr>          <lgl>                <chr>    <chr> <chr> #> 1 INEI      General     departamento   TRUE                 Nationa… 2019  http… #> 2 INEI      General     provincia      TRUE                 Nationa… 2019  http… #> 3 INEI      General     distritos      TRUE                 Nationa… 2019  http… #> 4 Midagri   Agriculture agriculture_s… TRUE                 Ministr… 2024  http… #> 5 Midagri   Agriculture oil_palm_areas TRUE                 Ministr… 2016… http… #> 6 Geobosque Forest      stock_bosque_… FALSE                Ministr… 2001… http… get_providers()  #> # A tibble: 8 × 2 #>   provider  layer_count #>   <fct>           <int> #> 1 Geobosque           5 #> 2 INAIGEM             3 #> 3 INEI                7 #> 4 Midagri             2 #> 5 MTC                27 #> 6 Senamhi             1 #> 7 Serfor              1 #> 8 Sernanp            61

what: Example 02: Download official INEI administrative boundaries
title: Download Peruvian data managed by the Spatial Data Infrastructure (SDI) of the National Institute of Statistics and Informatics (INEI) of Peru

code: get_data_sources(query = NULL)

text: query string. Default NULL. List available providers. details, use `get_providers` function.

text: tibble object.

code: # \donttest{ library(geoidep) get_data_sources() #> # A tibble: 107 × 7 #>    provider  category    layer         layer_can_be_actived admin_en year  link  #>    <chr>     <chr>       <chr>         <lgl>                <chr>    <chr> <chr> #>  1 INEI      General     departamento  TRUE                 Nationa… 2019  http… #>  2 INEI      General     provincia     TRUE                 Nationa… 2019  http… #>  3 INEI      General     distritos     TRUE                 Nationa… 2019  http… #>  4 Midagri   Agriculture agriculture_… TRUE                 Ministr… 2024  http… #>  5 Midagri   Agriculture oil_palm_are… TRUE                 Ministr… 2016… http… #>  6 Geobosque Forest      stock_bosque… FALSE                Ministr… 2001… http… #>  7 Geobosque Forest      stock_bosque… TRUE                 Ministr… 2001… http… #>  8 Geobosque Forest      stock_bosque… TRUE                 Ministr… 2001… http… #>  9 Geobosque Forest      stock_bosque… TRUE                 Ministr… 2001… http… #> 10 Geobosque Forest      warning_last… TRUE                 Ministr… last… http… #> # ℹ 97 more rows # }

title: Download INEI departmental boundaries — get_departaments
text: function allows download latest version geometry ubigeos corresponding official political division departament boundaries Peru. information, can visit following page INEI Spatial Data Portal.

title: Download INEI departmental boundaries — get_departaments
code: get_departaments(dsn = NULL, show_progress = TRUE, quiet = TRUE, timeout = 60)

title: Download INEI departmental boundaries — get_departaments
text: dsn Character. Path output .gpkg file directory file saved. directory provided, file saved DEPARTAMENTO.gpkg inside . NULL, temporary file created. path contains multiple subdirectories, created automatically exist. show_progress Logical. Suppress bar progress. quiet Logical. Suppress info message. timeout Seconds. Number seconds wait response giving . less 1 ms. Default 60.

title: Download INEI departmental boundaries — get_departaments
text: sf tibble object.

title: Download INEI departmental boundaries — get_departaments
code: # \donttest{ library(geoidep) dep <- get_departaments(show_progress = FALSE) head(dep) #> Simple feature collection with 6 features and 6 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -79.45857 ymin: -17.28501 xmax: -70.80408 ymax: -2.986125 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #>   id objectid ccdd   nombdep shape_length shape_area #> 1  1        1   01  AMAZONAS    13.059047   3.199147 #> 2  2        2   02    ANCASH    11.788249   2.954697 #> 3  3        3   03  APURIMAC     7.730154   1.765933 #> 4  4        4   04  AREQUIPA    17.459435   5.330125 #> 5  5        5   05  AYACUCHO    17.127166   3.643705 #> 6  6        6   06 CAJAMARCA    12.540288   2.688386 #>                             geom #> 1 MULTIPOLYGON (((-77.81399 -... #> 2 MULTIPOLYGON (((-77.64697 -... #> 3 MULTIPOLYGON (((-73.74655 -... #> 4 MULTIPOLYGON (((-71.98109 -... #> 5 MULTIPOLYGON (((-74.34843 -... #> 6 MULTIPOLYGON (((-78.70034 -... # }

title: Download INEI district boundaries — get_districts

title: Download INEI district boundaries — get_districts
code: get_districts(dsn = NULL, show_progress = TRUE, quiet = TRUE, timeout = 60)

title: Download INEI district boundaries — get_districts
text: dsn Character. Path output .gpkg file directory file saved. directory provided, file saved DISTRITO.gpkg inside . NULL, temporary file created. path contains multiple subdirectories, created automatically exist. show_progress Logical. Suppress bar progress. quiet Logical. Suppress info message. timeout Seconds. Number seconds wait response giving . less 1 ms. Default 60.

what: Download information on the latest deforestation alerts detected by Geobosque — get_early_warning
title: Download information on the latest deforestation alerts detected by Geobosque — get_early_warning
text: function allows download deforestation alert information detected Geobosque polygon located Peru. details, please visit following website: Geobosque Platform

title: Download information on the latest deforestation alerts detected by Geobosque — get_early_warning
code: get_early_warning(region, sf = TRUE, show_progress = TRUE)

title: Download information on the latest deforestation alerts detected by Geobosque — get_early_warning
text: region string Specifies unique geographical code interest. sf Logical. Indicates whether return data `sf` object. show_progress Logical. TRUE, shows progress bar download.

title: Download information on the latest deforestation alerts detected by Geobosque — get_early_warning
text: tibble sf object, depending value `sf`.

title: Download information on the latest deforestation alerts detected by Geobosque — get_early_warning
code: # \donttest{ library(geoidep) amazonas <- get_departaments(show_progress = FALSE) |> subset(nombdep == "AMAZONAS") warning_point <- get_early_warning(region = amazonas, sf = TRUE, show_progress = FALSE) head(warning_point) #> Simple feature collection with 6 features and 1 field #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -77.79937 ymin: -4.701213 xmax: -77.79801 ymax: -4.700941 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>   descrip                     geometry #>   <chr>                    <POINT [°]> #> 1 Warning points  (-77.7991 -4.700941) #> 2 Warning points (-77.79883 -4.700941) #> 3 Warning points (-77.79856 -4.700941) #> 4 Warning points (-77.79829 -4.700941) #> 5 Warning points (-77.79801 -4.700941) #> 6 Warning points (-77.79937 -4.701213) # }

what: Geobosque API to get deforestation hot-spots for the last week — get_early_warning_link
title: Geobosque API to get deforestation hot-spots for the last week — get_early_warning_link
text: Geobosque API get deforestation hot-spots last week

title: Geobosque API to get deforestation hot-spots for the last week — get_early_warning_link
code: get_early_warning_link(type = NULL)

title: Geobosque API to get deforestation hot-spots for the last week — get_early_warning_link
text: type string. one layer; `warning_last_week`

title: Geobosque API to get deforestation hot-spots for the last week — get_early_warning_link
text: string containing URL requested file.

what: Download the forest and loss information from Geobosque — get_forest_loss_data
title: Download the forest and loss information from Geobosque — get_forest_loss_data
text: function allows download ubigeos corresponding official political division district, province region boundaries Peru forest loss information. information, can visit following website: Geobosque Platform

title: Download the forest and loss information from Geobosque — get_forest_loss_data
code: get_forest_loss_data(layer = NULL, ubigeo = NULL, show_progress = TRUE)

title: Download the forest and loss information from Geobosque — get_forest_loss_data
text: layer string.Specifies one following available layers; stock_bosque_perdida_distrito, stock_bosque_perdida_provincia, stock_bosque_perdida_departamento. ubigeo string Specifies unique geographical code interest. show_progress Logical. Indicates whether display progress bar.

title: Download the forest and loss information from Geobosque — get_forest_loss_data
text: tibble object.

title: Download the forest and loss information from Geobosque — get_forest_loss_data
text: Available layers : stock_bosque_perdida_distrito: Returns data forest stock, forest loss, rank loss given district. stock_bosque_perdida_provincia: Returns data forest stock, forest loss, rank loss given province. stock_bosque_perdida_departamento: Returns data forest stock, forest loss, rank loss given region.

title: Download the forest and loss information from Geobosque — get_forest_loss_data

title: Download the available data from INAIGEM — get_inaigem_data
text: layer Select one list available layers, information please use `get_data_sources(provider = "INAIGEM")`. Defaults NULL. dsn Character. Number seconds wait response giving . less 1 ms. Default 60.

title: Download Geographic Information from MIDAGRI — get_midagri_data
text: layer string. Specifies layer download. Available layers detailed 'Details' section. dsn Character. output filename .shp .gpkg format. provided, temporary file created. show_progress Logical. TRUE, displays progress bar download. quiet Logical. TRUE, suppresses informational messages.

title: Download Geographic Information from MIDAGRI — get_midagri_data
text: `sf` object containing downloaded geographic data.

title: Download Geographic Information from MIDAGRI — get_midagri_data
text: Available layers : agriculture_sector: Polygons representing new national register agricultural statistical sectors year 2024. oil_palm_areas: Polygons representing areas cultivated oil palm Peru period 2016 2020.

title: Download Geographic Information from MIDAGRI — get_midagri_data
code: # \donttest{ library(geoidep) library(sf) # Disable the use of S2 geometry for accurate spatial operations sf_use_s2(use_s2 = FALSE) #> Spherical geometry (s2) switched off  # Retrieve the polygon for Coronel Portillo province coronel_portillo <- get_provinces(show_progress = FALSE) names(coronel_portillo) #> [1] "id"           "objectid"     "ccdd"         "ccpp"         "nombdep"      #> [6] "nombprov"     "shape_length" "shape_area"   "geom"          roi <- coronel_portillo |>  subset(nombprov == "CORONEL PORTILLO") |>  st_transform(crs = 32718)  oil_palm_areas <- get_midagri_data(layer = "oil_palm_areas", show_progress = FALSE) |>  st_intersection(roi) #> Warning: attribute variables are assumed to be spatially constant throughout all geometries  head(oil_palm_areas) #> Simple feature collection with 6 features and 11 fields #> Geometry type: POLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 493306.5 ymin: 9088071 xmax: 512077.7 ymax: 9106609 #> Projected CRS: WGS 84 / UTM zone 18S #>          Area_ha Fecha   ID  id objectid ccdd ccpp nombdep         nombprov #> 1153 1.251994689  2018 1153 191      191   25   01 UCAYALI CORONEL PORTILLO #> 1154 0.480333935  2018 1154 191      191   25   01 UCAYALI CORONEL PORTILLO #> 1155 0.007059493  2018 1155 191      191   25   01 UCAYALI CORONEL PORTILLO #> 1156 4.339065218  2018 1156 191      191   25   01 UCAYALI CORONEL PORTILLO #> 1157 0.254746310  2018 1157 191      191   25   01 UCAYALI CORONEL PORTILLO #> 1158 1.959960062  2018 1158 191      191   25   01 UCAYALI CORONEL PORTILLO #>      shape_length shape_area                       geometry #> 1153     12.79225   3.157117 POLYGON ((494177.3 9088348,... #> 1154     12.79225   3.157117 POLYGON ((493646.9 9088369,... #> 1155     12.79225   3.157117 POLYGON ((493306.5 9088071,... #> 1156     12.79225   3.157117 POLYGON ((507756.7 9102683,... #> 1157     12.79225   3.157117 POLYGON ((512077.7 9106359,... #> 1158     12.79225   3.157117 POLYGON ((511688.8 9106562,... plot(st_geometry(oil_palm_areas))  # }

title: Download the available data from Sernanp — get_sernanp_data
text: layer Select one list available layers, information please use `get_data_sources(provider = "sernanp")`. Defaults NULL. dsn Character. Output filename spatial format. missing, temporary file created. show_progress Logical. Suppress bar progress. quiet Logical. Suppress info message.

title: Download the available data from Sernanp — get_sernanp_data
text: sf object.

title: Download the available data from Sernanp — get_sernanp_data
code: # \donttest{ library(geoidep) library(sf) anp <- get_sernanp_data(layer = "zonificacion_anp" , show_progress = FALSE) #> Reading layer `file1f8c3fd1ed2' from data source  #>   `/tmp/RtmpKrqUdl/file1f8c3fd1ed2.geojson' using driver `GeoJSON' #> Simple feature collection with 36 features and 7 fields #> Geometry type: POLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -83.12596 ymin: -18.39136 xmax: -70.49201 ymax: -3.385678 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 plot(st_geometry(anp))  # }

what: Retrieve links to SERNANP for information on natural protected areas. — get_sernanp_link

text: Retrieve links SERNANP information natural protected areas.

code: get_sernanp_link(type = NULL)

title: Retrieve links to SERNANP for information on natural protected areas. — get_sernanp_link
text: type string. Select one list available layers, information please use `get_data_sources(provider = "sernanp")`. Defaults NULL.

title: Retrieve links to SERNANP for information on natural protected areas. — get_sernanp_link
text: string containing URL requested file.

what: Global variables for get_early_warning This code declares global variables used in the `get_early_warning` function to avoid R CMD check warnings. — global-variables
title: Global variables for get_early_warning This code declares global variables used in the `get_early_warning` function to avoid R CMD check warnings. — global-variables
text: Global variables get_early_warning code declares global variables used `get_early_warning` function avoid R CMD check warnings.

what: Retrieve Senamhi's weather alert details using the warning number — senamhi_alert_by_number
title: Retrieve Senamhi's weather alert details using the warning number — senamhi_alert_by_number
text: function obtains table specified weather warning number. information, please visit following link: https://www.Senamhi.gob.pe/?&p=aviso-meteorologico

title: Retrieve Senamhi's weather alert details using the warning number — senamhi_alert_by_number
code: senamhi_alert_by_number(nro = NULL)

title: Retrieve Senamhi's weather alert details using the warning number — senamhi_alert_by_number
text: nro numeric value. Represents number weather warning issued Senamhi.

title: Retrieve Senamhi's weather alert details using the warning number — senamhi_alert_by_number
text: tibble object containing weather alert data.

title: Retrieve Senamhi's weather alert details using the warning number — senamhi_alert_by_number
code: # \donttest{ library(geoidep) data <- senamhi_alert_by_number(295) #> Reading data from the website... #> Data successfully uploaded. head(data) #> # A tibble: 2 × 7 #>   aviso                                nro   emision inicio fin   duracion nivel #>   <chr>                                <chr> <chr>   <chr>  <chr> <chr>    <chr> #> 1 PRECIPITACIONES EN LA SIERRA         295   2024-1… 2024-… 2024… 47 Hrs.  NARA… #> 2 PRECIPITACIONES EN LA COSTA NORTE Y… 295   2023-1… 2023-… 2023… 47 Hrs.  ROJO  # }

what: Download Senamhi's Meteorological Alerts by year — senamhi_alerts_by_year
title: Download Senamhi's Meteorological Alerts by year — senamhi_alerts_by_year
text: function downloads weather forecast table provided Senamhi according specified year.

title: Download Senamhi's Meteorological Alerts by year — senamhi_alerts_by_year
code: senamhi_alerts_by_year(data = NULL, year = NULL)

title: Download Senamhi's Meteorological Alerts by year — senamhi_alerts_by_year
text: data tibble object containing weather alert data. year numeric value indicating year publication weather warning.

title: Download Senamhi's Meteorological Alerts by year — senamhi_alerts_by_year
text: tibble object containing weather alert data.

title: Download Senamhi's Meteorological Alerts by year — senamhi_alerts_by_year
code: # \donttest{ library(geoidep) data <- senamhi_alerts_by_year(year = 2024) #> Reading data from the website... #> Data successfully uploaded. head(data) #> # A tibble: 6 × 7 #>   aviso                                nro   emision inicio fin   duracion nivel #>   <chr>                                <chr> <chr>   <chr>  <chr> <chr>    <chr> #> 1 PRECIPITACIONES EN LA SIERRA         399   2024-1… 2025-… 2025… 71 Hrs.  NARA… #> 2 LLUVIA EN LA SELVA                   398   2024-1… 2024-… 2025… 57 Hrs.  NARA… #> 3 PRECIPITACIONES EN LA SIERRA         397   2024-1… 2024-… 2024… 71 Hrs.  NARA… #> 4 INCREMENTO DE LA TEMPERATURA DIURNA… 396   2024-1… 2024-… 2024… 47 Hrs.  NARA… #> 5 INCREMENTO DE LA TEMPERATURA DIURNA… 395   2024-1… 2024-… 2024… 37 Hrs.  NARA… #> 6 PRECIPITACIONES EN LA SIERRA NORTE … 394   2024-1… 2024-… 2024… 57 Hrs.  NARA… # }

title: Download Weather Alert Table from Senamhi — senamhi_get_meteorological_table
code: senamhi_get_meteorological_table()

title: Download Weather Alert Table from Senamhi — senamhi_get_meteorological_table
text: tibble object containing weather alert data.

title: Download Weather Alert Table from Senamhi — senamhi_get_meteorological_table
code: # \donttest{ library(geoidep) data <- senamhi_get_meteorological_table() #> Reading data from the website... #> Data successfully uploaded. head(data) #> # A tibble: 6 × 7 #>   aviso                                nro   emision inicio fin   duracion nivel #>   <chr>                                <chr> <chr>   <chr>  <chr> <chr>    <chr> #> 1 INCREMENTO DE VIENTO EN LA COSTA     071 … 2025-0… 2025-… 2025… 58 Hrs.  NARA… #> 2 LLUVIA EN LA SELVA - PRIMER FRIAJE   070 … 2025-0… 2025-… 2025… 47 Hrs.  NARA… #> 3 PRECIPITACIONES EN LA SIERRA CENTRO… 069 … 2025-0… 2025-… 2025… 47 Hrs.  NARA… #> 4 LLUVIA EN LA SELVA (EXTENSIÓN DEL A… 068 … 2025-0… 2025-… 2025… 47 Hrs.  NARA… #> 5 INCREMENTO DE VIENTO EN LA COSTA CE… 067 … 2025-0… 2025-… 2025… 71 Hrs.  NARA… #> 6 PRECIPITACIONES EN LA COSTA NORTE Y… 066   2025-0… 2025-… 2025… 71 Hrs.  NARA… # }

what: Download Meteorological Alerts from Senamhi — senamhi_get_spatial_alerts
title: Download Meteorological Alerts from Senamhi — senamhi_get_spatial_alerts
text: function downloads loads spatial format weather warnings provided Senamhi. geometries represent preventive forecasts severe events, indicating areas may affected level danger. information, please visit following link: https://www.Senamhi.gob.pe/?&p=aviso-meteorologico

title: Download Meteorological Alerts from Senamhi — senamhi_get_spatial_alerts
code: senamhi_get_spatial_alerts(   data = NULL,   nro = NULL,   year = NULL,   dsn = NULL,   show_progress = TRUE,   quiet = TRUE )

title: Download Meteorological Alerts from Senamhi — senamhi_get_spatial_alerts
text: data data frame containing information weather warnings provided Senamhi. nro numeric value representing weather warning number. year numeric value indicating year publication weather warning. dsn character string specifying output filename spatial format. missing, temporary file created. show_progress logical value indicating whether suppress progress bar. quiet logical value indicating whether suppress informational messages.

title: Download Meteorological Alerts from Senamhi — senamhi_get_spatial_alerts
text: sf object containing spatial geometries weather alerts.

title: Download Meteorological Alerts from Senamhi — senamhi_get_spatial_alerts
code: # \donttest{ library(geoidep) data <- senamhi_get_spatial_alerts(nro = 295, year = 2024, show_progress = FALSE) head(data) #> Simple feature collection with 4 features and 13 fields #> Geometry type: POLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -81.32823 ymin: -18.35093 xmax: -68.65228 ymax: -0.03860597 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #>     gid nro_aviso nro_mapa   nivel  fecha_emi cod_fen cod_even   fech_ini #> 1 15063       295        1 Nivel 1 2024-10-08       1       01 2024-10-10 #> 2 15060       295        1 Nivel 1 2024-10-08       1       01 2024-10-10 #> 3 15062       295        1 Nivel 2 2024-10-08       1       01 2024-10-10 #> 4 15061       295        1 Nivel 3 2024-10-08       1       01 2024-10-10 #>     fech_fin cod_sede respons pub cap                       geometry #> 1 2024-10-10       00  JMESIA   3   0 POLYGON ((-80.28521 -3.4127... #> 2 2024-10-10       00  JMESIA   3   0 POLYGON ((-73.16392 -13.652... #> 3 2024-10-10       00  JMESIA   3   0 POLYGON ((-73.15807 -13.655... #> 4 2024-10-10       00  JMESIA   3   0 POLYGON ((-77.83104 -6.8805... # }
